bergmark_d wrote:

> ...
> I successfully compiled my code against the new snapshot but at
> run-time something very strange happened: a runtime error from my
> Postselector subclass's innerProcess method.  The statement in
> question is:
>
>    protected void innerProcess ( CrawlURI curi ) {
>                   :
>      if (curi.containsKey(A_PREREQUISITE_URI)) {
>
> The runtime error is that there is no containsKey(String) method
> in CrawlURI (!):
>
>    java.lang.NoSuchMethodError:  
>    org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CrawlURI.containsKey
>    (Ljava/lang/String;)
>
This is odd.  Its as though your runtime is using an old jar.  Try 
javap'ing the runtime jar to see what the CandidateURI looks like (Do 
something like: % /usr/local/jdk1.5.0/bin/javap -classpath 
./heritrix-1.3.0.jar org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CandidateURI).  You 
should see a listing of methods that includes containsKey, etc.

I just tried making a new Postselector stuffing items into the 
CandidateURI#alist.  Basic types (putString, putLong, etc.) work fine -- 
I didn't have the issues you described above in your email -- but if I 
try and shove the parent CrawlURI into the CandidateURI#alist using 
putObject, I get serialization exceptions out of BdbFrontier when it 
schedules/queues the resulting CrawlURI.  Being able to add any old 
'Object' to a CandidateURI/CrawlURI is just asking for trouble. 

Is this going to be a problem for you?

St.Ack
